treatmentLine.selectedListName: DMARD - Interleukin-6 (IL-6) Receptor Inhibitors, Monoclonal Antibody
DMARD - Antinflammatory, Select. costimulation modulator,T-cell Inhib.

dosing.text: 45 mg inititally and at week 4, then 45 mg once every 12 weeks.
Members with concurrent moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis weighing > 100 kg (220 lbs): 90 mg inititally and at week 4, then 90 mg once every 12 weeks.

qlimit.initPerIntervalDesc: 2 syringes for the first 4 weeks, then 1 syringe every 12 weeks
2 syringes for the first 4 weeks, then 1 syringe every 12 weeks

references.reference: Stelara [package insert]. Horsham, PA: Janssen Biotech, Inc; 2012

Gottlieb A, Korman NJ, Gordon KB, et al. Guidelines of care for the management of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis: Section 2. Psoriatic arthritis: overview and guidelines of care for treatment with an emphasis on the biologics. J Am Acad Dermatol. 2009; 58: 851-64.

treatmentLine.selectedListName: DMARD - Interleukin-6 (IL-6) Receptor Inhibitors, Monoclonal Antibody
DMARD - Antinflammatory, Select. costimulation modulator,T-cell Inhib.

dosing.text: Members weighing ≤ 100 kg (220 lbs): 45 mg inititally and at week 4, then 45 mg once every 12 weeks.
Members with concurrent moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis weighing > 100 kg (220 lbs): 90 mg inititally and at week 4, then 90 mg once every 12 weeks.

qlimit.initPerIntervalDesc: 2 syringes for the first 4 weeks, then 1 syringe every 12 weeks
2 syringes for the first 4 weeks, then 1 syringe every 12 weeks

references.reference: Stelara [package insert]. Horsham, PA: Janssen Biotech, Inc; 2012
Hsu S, Papp KA, Lebwohl MG, et al. Consensus Guidelines for the Management of Plaque Psoriasis. Arch Dermatol. 2012; 148: 95-102. DOI 10.1001/archdermatol.2011.1410

Voorhees AV, Feldman SR, Koo JYM, et al. The Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis Pocket Guide: Treatment algorithms and management options. National Psoriasis Foundation. http://www.psoriasis.org/document.doc?id=354. Published 2009. Accessed September 4, 2014.
Mrowietz U, Kragballe K, Reich K, et al. Definition of treatment goals for moderate to severe psoriasis: a European consensus. Arch Dermatol Res. 2011; 303: 1–10. DOI 10.1007/s00403-010-1080-1

treatmentLine.selectedListName: Crohns Disease - Aminosalicylates and Related Agents
Inflammatory Bowel Agent - Integrin Receptor Antagonist, MC Antibody
DMARD - Interleukin-6 (IL-6) Receptor Inhibitors, Monoclonal Antibody
DMARD - Antinflammatory, Select. costimulation modulator,T-cell Inhib.
Antipsoriatic Agents - MC Antibody, Human Interleukin 12/23 Inhibitors

dosing.text: Initial dose (Day 1): 160 mg (four 40 mg injections in one day or two 40 mg injections per day for two consecutive days).
Second dose two weeks later (Day 15): 80 mg
Two weeks later (Day 29): Begin a maintenance dose of 40 mg every other week.
Note: Some patients may require a maintenance dose of 40 mg every week

qlimit.initPerIntervalDesc: 1 starter pack for the first 28 days only
6 pens per 28 days for the first 4 weeks
6 kits per 28 days for the first 4 weeks

references.reference: Humira [package insert]. North Chicago, IL: AbbVie Inc; 2014
Lichtenstein GR, Hanauer SB, Sandborn WJ. Management of Crohn's Disease in Adutls. Am J Gastroenterol. 2009; 104: 465-83. doi: 10.1038/ajg.2008.168

Sandborn WJ, Feagan BG, Lichtenstein GR. Medical management of mild to moderate Crohn's disease: evidence-based treatment algorithms for induction and maintenance of remission. Aliment Pharmacol Ther. 2007; 26: 987-1003.
Thomson ABR, Gupta M, Freeman HJ. Use of the tumor necrosis factor-blockers for Crohn's disease. World J Gastroenterol. 2012; 18: 4823-54. doi:10.3748/wjg.v18.i35.4823
